block.p: ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES INC., Sunnyvale, Calif., named Robert Rivet, senior vice president and director of finance for the semiconductor products sector at Motorola, senior vice president and chief financial officer. He succeeds Francis Barton, who is assisting Mr. Rivet during the transition.

ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES INC., Sunnyvale, Calif., named Robert Rivet, senior vice president and director of finance for the semiconductor products sector at Motorola, senior vice president and chief financial officer. He succeeds Francis Barton, who is assisting Mr. Rivet during the transition.

BIOSOURCE INTERNATIONAL INC., Camarillo, Calif., named Russell D. Hays chairman, president and chief executive and George Uveges chief operating officer. Mr. Hays succeeds James H. Chamberlain, who is retiring, and Mr. Uveges succeeds Gus Davis, who is also retiring.

SOPHOS INC., Wakefield Mass., named David Hughes, vice president for strategy at the Lotus division of I.B.M., president of United States operations. He is succeeding Richard Jacobs, who became technical director.
STANDISH, AYER & WOOD INC., Boston, named Richard S. Wood president and chief executive. He succeeds George W. Noyes, who will become vice chairman.
